snippet: Chinese authorities, who are wary of dissent as the occasion approaches, arrested the outspoken Gao Yu under a state secrets law that critics call vague and overly broad.
abstract: Outspoken Chinese journalist Gao Yu, who was jailed after the armed crackdown on Tiananmen Square protests in 1989, has been detained in Beijing on charges of obtaining and leaking a confidential Communist Party document; announcement of the charges against Gao comes while Chinese government seeks to stifle dissent ahead of the 25th anniversary of Tiananmen Square.
lead_paragraph: Chinese authorities, who are wary of dissent as the occasion approaches, arrested the outspoken Gao Yu under a state secrets law that critics call vague and overly broad.

headline.main: Dissident Journalist Held Ahead of Tiananmen Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Dissident Journalist Held Ahead of Tiananmen Anniversary

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
